title: Gold tops $5,000 for first time ever, adding to historic rally
byline: The price of gold has risen above $5,000 (£3,659) an ounce for the first time, extending a historic rally that saw the precious metal jump by more than 60% in 2025.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers in Northern, North-central, Eastern, North-western and Uva provinces and in Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts, today (26), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: GMOA to launch indefinite trade union action today
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to launch an island-wide indefinite trade union action from 8.00 a.m. today (26).

title: Trump administration defends killing American in Minneapolis, contradicts videos
byline: Officials in U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration defended on Sunday the fatal shooting of a U.S. citizen by immigration agents in Minneapolis, even as video evidence contradicted their version of events and as tensions grew between local law enforcement and federal officers.

title: U.S. storm leaves 1 million without power, forces 10,000 flight cancellations
byline: More than 1 million customers in the United States, as far west as New Mexico, were without electricity, and over 10,000 flights were canceled on Sunday during a monster winter storm that paralyzed eastern and southern states with heavy snow and ice.

title: India to slash tariffs on cars to 40% in trade deal with EU
byline: India plans to slash tariffs on cars imported from the European Union to 40% from as high as 110%, sources said, in the biggest opening yet of the country’s vast market as the two sides close in on a free trade pact that could come as early as Tuesday.

title: Suspect arrested with over 3 kg of ‘Ice’ in Bambalapitiya
byline: A suspect has been arrested while in possession of over 3 kilograms of ‘Crystal Methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘Ice’), with an estimated street value exceeding Rs. 30 million.

title: Death toll in Philippine boat accident climbs to 15, hundreds rescued
byline: The death toll from a ferry boat accident in the Southern Philippines has reached at least 15, with 316 people rescued, the Philippine Coast Guard said on Monday as the search continued for the dozens still missing.

title: Two arrested for illegal gem mining in Bogawantalawa
byline: Police have arrested two individuals for engaging in illegal gem mining without a valid license in Bogawantalawa.

title: Private jet crashes in flames at Maine airport with eight aboard
byline: A private jet crashed in flames as it was taking off from a Maine airport with eight aboard, the U.S. aviation regulator said, but their fate and identities were not immediately known.

title: First lady Melania Trump previews new film at private White House screening
byline: First lady Melania Trump hosted a private White House screening on Saturday of a new film documenting her life in the 20 days leading up to President Donald Trump’s second inauguration, the White House said.

title: Apple reportedly plans to reveal its Gemini-powered Siri in February
byline: A new and improved Siri may finally make an appearance, but this time, it could be with a Google Gemini glow up.

title: Heatwave warnings across Australia as millions celebrate national day
byline: Australian authorities have issued heatwave warnings for most of the country as millions celebrate Australia Day.

title: Six police officers arrested for allegedly assaulting Catholic priest further remanded
byline: Six police officers who were arrested for allegedly assaulting a Catholic priest in Gampaha have been further remanded until January 29, 2026.

title: India’s military might on full display at 77th Republic Day celebrations
byline: India ushered in its 77th Republic Day on Monday (January 26, 2026) with a grand display of its military prowess that included missiles, warplanes, newly-raised units and lethal weapon systems used during Operation Sindoor.

title: Govt invites land donations to rebuild homes destroyed by Cyclone ‘Ditwah’
byline: The project to construct houses for families whose homes were completely destroyed by Cyclone ‘Ditwah’ in Sri Lanka is currently underway.

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka rise in line with global market
byline: The price of a gold sovereign in in Sri Lanka has increased in line with the upward trend in global gold prices.

title: Another vessel and 5 suspects arrested for supplying narcotics to boats seized in southern seas
byline: Five more suspects and another vessel, suspected of supplying narcotics to the multi-day fishing boats recently intercepted off the southern coast by the Navy with over 290 kg of heroin and crystal methamphetamine (‘Ice’), have been taken into custody at the Mirissa Fisheries Harbour.

title: Channel 4 and CBC co-produce ‘Baby Elephant School’ at Sri Lanka’s Udawalawe Sanctuary
byline: A rare UK-Canada natural history co-pro will follow inhabitants at the world’s largest baby elephant sanctuary.

title: GMOA accuses Health Ministry for non-implementation of agreements
byline: The Secretary of the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA), Dr. Prabath Sugathadasa, stated that the association was compelled to take professional action as previous discussions with the Minister of Health, in which agreements were reached in writing, were not implemented as promised.

title: 213 Public Health Management Assistants to be appointed tomorrow
byline: A total of 213 individuals are scheduled to receive appointment letters for the position of Public Health Management Assistant tomorrow (27).

title: Sri Lanka’s export earnings top US$ 17 billion in 2025
byline: The total export earnings of Sri Lanka in 2025 has been recorded at US$ 17,252.15 million, exceeding the figures recorded in 2024, Sri Lanka Customs data indicates.

title: 2019 Easter Attacks: Case against Hemasiri, Pujith to be taken up once again in March
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the case filed against former Secretary to the Ministry of Defence Hemasiri Fernando and former IGP Pujith Jayasundara—who are accused of criminal negligence and failure to prevent the Easter Sunday attacks despite having received prior intelligence—be taken up again on 23 March.

title: Case filed against Diana Gamage adjourned till Feb. 16
byline: Further examination of evidence in the case filed against former State Minister Diana Gamage is scheduled to be conducted on February 16.

title: Sajith pledges full support for proper implementation of education reforms
byline: The Leader of the Opposition, Sajith Premadasa has assured that he would extend his full support if educational reforms are implemented in a proper and effective manner.

title: Central Bank likely to hold rates ahead of IMF review, experts say
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka is expected to maintain its key interest rate at 7.75% on Wednesday, a Reuters poll found, as an International Monetary Fund delegation reviews the sixth tranche of a crucial $2.9 billion package.

title: 30% of Sri Lanka’s adult population suffers from mental health issues – Experts
byline: Approximately 30% of Sri Lanka’s adult population suffers from mental health issues, Consultant Psychiatrist Dr. Madhushani Dias has revealed.

title: 20 injured following accident involving two buses and lorry in Yalkumbura
byline: At least 20 individuals have sustained injuries following an accident involving two buses and a lorry along the Bible–Badulla Road in Yalkumbura this afternoon (26), police stated.

title: SC informed orders have been issued preventing local agents of MV X-Press Pearl from leaving the country
byline: The Attorney General informed the Supreme Court today that orders have been obtained from the Colombo Magistrate’s Court and the Colombo High Court to prevent the directors of the local agent company of the MV X-Press Pearl from leaving the country.

title: Obama, Clinton say killings by immigration agents should be wake-up call for US
byline: Former presidents Barack Obama and Bill Clinton issued pointed calls on Sunday for Americans to stand up and defend their values after the second killing of a citizen in Minneapolis by immigration agents that Donald Trump blamed on Democratic “chaos”.

title: “Successful India makes world stable”: European Commission Chief
byline: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Monday said that a “successful India” makes the world more “stable, prosperous and secure”, a statement that came ahead of the “historic” trade agreement between New Delhi and the 27-nation bloc.

title: UK-Canada co-production ‘Baby Elephant School’ profiles Sri Lanka’s Udawalawe Sanctuary
byline: A rare UK-Canada natural history co-pro will follow inhabitants at the world’s largest baby elephant sanctuary.

title: Complaint lodged with CID over shortage of 40 cancer drugs and alleged sale of unregistered medicines
byline: A complaint has been lodged with the Criminal Investigation Department today calling for an investigation into an alleged shortage of 40 cancer medications and claims that unregistered cancer drugs are currently circulating in the market.

title: Nine including foreign couple injured in car-van collision on Anuradhapura–Kandy road
byline: At least nine individuals, including a foreign couple, have been injured following a head-on collision between a car and a van on the Anuradhapura–Kandy main road.

title: Sectoral Oversight Committee approves Poisons, Opium and Dangerous Drugs Bill and the Judicature Amendment Bill
byline: The Sectoral Oversight Committee on Governance, Justice and Civil Protection has approved the Poisons, Opium and Dangerous Drugs (Amendment) Bill and the Judicature (Amendment) Bill.

title: Immigration officials foil Bangladeshi national’s attempt to leave for Spain using forged visa
byline: A Bangladeshi national has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to travel to Spain using a forged visa.

title: Israel to reopen Gaza crossing after search for last dead hostage’s body ends
byline: Israel says it has agreed to reopen the Gaza Strip’s key border crossing with Egypt only after an operation to retrieve the body of the last remaining Israeli hostage in the territory is complete.

title: Gunmen storm Mexico football pitch and kill at least 11 people
byline: At least 11 people were killed and another dozen injured when gunmen opened fire on locals who had gathered at a football pitch in the city of Salamanca in central Mexico on Sunday.

title: Concerns raised as Sri Lanka see spike in crime among 16–22-year-olds
byline: Criminal behavior among youth aged between 16 and 22 years has increased over the past 10 years, Consultant Forensic Psychiatrist Dr. Tharaka Fernando stated.

title: Specialist warns of growing mental health issues linked to mobile phone addiction
byline: A number of adolescents have developed various mental health disorders as a result of excessive dependence on mobile phones, Child and Adolescent Psychiatrist Dr. Senani Wijethunga has stated.

title: 173 individuals remain missing following Cyclone Ditwah
byline: A total of 173 individuals remain unaccounted due to landslides and floods triggered by Cyclone Ditwah, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) has confirmed.

title: French lawmakers to vote on social media ban for children
byline: French lawmakers on Monday (Jan 26) were set to vote on draft legislation to ban social media for under-15s, an effort championed by President Emmanuel Macron as a way to protect children from excessive screen time.

title: Gold hits record above $5,100 as geopolitics drive safe‑haven rush
byline: Gold prices marched to record levels above $5,100 on Monday, as investors sought a safe haven away from international political tension, and silver and platinum also scaled all-time highs.

title: Station Masters threaten to launch trade union action over unresolved issues
byline: The Sri Lanka Railway Station Masters’ Association has warned that unless existing issues are resolved promptly, it may be compelled to launch trade union action.

title: President to inaugurate programme to restore religious sites damaged by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The government has decided to launch a national programme under the theme “Godanagamu Adhishtanaye Sanhinda” to promptly restore religious sites damaged by Cyclone Ditwah and make them available for worship and other religious activities.

title: Coal tender controversy results in significant daily losses – Patali
byline: The country is losing approximately two gigawatt-hours of electricity per day due to the controversial coal tender, former Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka has stated.

title: Katunayake logs today’s highest temperature
byline: The highest temperature recorded in the country today (26) was 34.6°C, reported from the Katunayake Meteorological Station, the Department of Meteorology noted.

title: Political leaders share stage at 77th Indian Republic Day celebrations in Colombo
byline: A special reception to welcome distinguished guests was held at the India House in Colombo this evening (26) in commemoration of the 77th Republic Day of India.

title: Egoda Uyana Police Traffic OIC killed in road accident
byline: The Officer-in-Charge of the Traffic Division of the Egoda Uyana Police Station has died in a road accident in Moronthuduwa.

title: Israel says it has retrieved remains of final Gaza hostage
byline: The Israeli military says it has retrieved the body of the last hostage in Gaza, paving the way for the next phase of US President Donald Trump’s peace plan to get under way.
